comments:
I20060330-0010

Dropping on an empty line in StyledText is hard: I have to move the mouse manually to the beginning of the line - that's now what I'm used from other editors.

Can be reproduced using SWT Snippet 210:
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/org.eclipse.swt.snippets/src/org/eclipse/swt/snippets/Snippet210.java

This seems not to work. When using snippet 210, then adding a some newlines and start drag I get:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2006-04-26 11:40:51.422
!MESSAGE Unable to create editor ID org.eclipse.jdt.ui.CompilationUnitEditor: Argument not valid
!STACK 0
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Argument not valid
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3358)

	at org.eclipse.swt.dnd.DropTarget.DragOver(DropTarget.java:355)

	at org.eclipse.swt.dnd.DragSource.drag(DragSource.java:306)

Ooops didn't test \r\n, only tested \n.

Fixed (again) for 3.2 RC2.
